name: Aubergine Casserole
title: Aubergine Casserole
imageAltText: Aubergine casserole served in a bowl with bread and a drink
instructions: Wash and cut the aubergines into 1.5cm slices lengthways.
Add to a baking tray with at least 75ml olive oil, with a teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Mix well: make sure each slice has oil and seasoning.
Roast for 30 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 180 Celcius and continue roasting for another 10-15 minutes (you can continue the steps below while it cooks).
Dice the onion. Crush the garlic. Chop the peppers. Put the cinnamon, chilli flakes and cumin seeds in a grinder, crush well.
Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to a pan on medium-high heat. Fry the onions for 5-7 minutes until soft and light brown. Then add the spices, garlic and tomato paste. Cook for 1 minute.

Boil some water. Add the peppers, chickpeas, tinned tomatoes and sugar. Add 200ml of the boiling water. Season with just over a teaspoon of salt and a strong pinch of black pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Chop the coriander and add that to the sauce towards the end.
Line an ovenproof dish with a 1/2 tablespoon of olive oil and a layer of sliced tomatoes. Spread half the aubergine mix on top. Then layer the sauce. Final layer of tomatoes + aubergine.
Drizzle with some olive oil, wrap in aluminium foil and cook in the oven for 30 minutes. Optionally remove the foil and cook for a further 20 minutes.
Garnish with a bit of coriander and serve with crusty bread.
